title: Major League Cricket Names Johnny Grave As New CEO
body:
DALLAS, Jan. 17, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Major League Cricket (MLC) is pleased to announce the appointment of Johnny Grave as Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the professional Twenty20 cricket league in the U.S.

Grave brings nearly 25 years of leadership experience in international cricket. As CEO of Cricket West Indies (CWI) for the past seven years, Grave enhanced the governance, cultivated a high-performance culture, and maximized the commercial and cricketing opportunities for the organization. He also oversaw three World Cups hosted in the West Indies and was the T20 World Cup CEO for the 2024 men's T20 World Cup co-hosted with the U.S. this past June. As Commercial Director at the Professional Cricketers' Association (PCA) in England for 10 years, he drove strategic planning, financial growth, and operational management.

"The MLC Board is excited to welcome Johnny as the new CEO of Major League Cricket," said Anurag Jain, Board of Directors Member and Human Resources Committee Member of MLC and Co-owner of the Texas Super Kings. "His deep understanding of the sport, vision for the future, and expertise in sports management will be invaluable as we continue to grow the sport across the United States and prepare for cricket to be on the global stage during the 2028 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles."

"We are confident that Johnny's leadership will be a key driver as we continue to grow Major League Cricket," said Venky Harinarayan, Board of Directors Member of MLC. "His extensive experience in international cricket and deep connections within the global cricketing community will be crucial as we expand the league, enhance our partnerships, and increase fan engagement in the U.S."

Within the position as CEO of MLC, Grave will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of MLC's operations, including league expansion, team development and strategic partnerships. He will focus on further strengthening MLC's position as the premier professional cricket league in the United States.

"I am honored to lead the league at this transformative time," said Grave. "Cricket is beloved globally and I am thrilled to see its fan base growing rapidly in the United States. I look forward to working with the MLC team to help elevate the league, engage with fans, and build a thriving, sustainable future for cricket in America."

The appointment comes at a pivotal moment for MLC as the league enters its third season and prepares for expansion in the U.S. market with plans to expand to more cities in the coming years. Cricket is being re-introduced at the 2028 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, California after it was last played in the Summer Olympics in 1900. With plans to expand to more cities in the coming years, MLC is poised to become a central figure in the global cricket ecosystem.

MLC's 2025 season opens in June with ticket sales beginning in May. For more information about MLC and to purchase tickets, please visit majorleaguecricket.com.

ABOUT MAJOR LEAGUE CRICKET

Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 franchise cricket championship in the United States. Exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC features superstar players from around the globe, bringing world-class T20 cricket to America. Six teams make up the MLC and include the Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings and Washington Freedom. For more information, visit www.majorleaguecricket.com and follow MLC on Twitter at www.twitter.com/MLCricket.

title: Johnny Grave Takes the Helm as Major League Cricket's New CEO
body:
Johnny Grave Appointed as CEO of Major League Cricket

Major League Cricket (MLC) is thrilled to announce the appointment of Johnny Grave as the new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of this professional Twenty20 cricket league in the U.S. With nearly 25 years of leadership experience in international cricket, Grave is set to reshape the future of the league as it prepares for its upcoming season.

Experience and Achievements

Before taking on this pivotal role at MLC, Johnny Grave served as the CEO of Cricket West Indies (CWI) for seven years. He played a vital role in enhancing the governance of CWI, fostering a high-performance culture, and maximizing commercial opportunities for the organization. His leadership was instrumental in overseeing three World Cups hosted in the West Indies, and he was also the CEO for the T20 World Cup in 2024, which was co-hosted with the U.S. earlier this year.

Contributions at the Professional Cricketers' Association

Grave's extensive experience includes being the Commercial Director at the Professional Cricketers' Association (PCA) in England for a decade. During his tenure at the PCA, he spearheaded strategic initiatives that led to significant financial growth and improved operational management.

Board Members Express Excitement

Anurag Jain, a Board Member and Human Resources Committee Member at MLC, expressed his enthusiasm about Johnny's appointment. He believes that Grave’s deep understanding of cricket, vision for the future, and expertise in sports management will be invaluable. As MLC looks to elevate cricket's presence across the U.S. and aims to be a prominent player on the global stage during the 2028 Summer Olympics, Jain's confidence in Grave's abilities is palpable.

Venky Harinarayan's Support

Moreover, Venky Harinarayan, another board member of MLC, echoed these sentiments. He stated that Grave's vast experience in international cricket and his strong connections within the global cricketing community would play a crucial role in the expansion of the league. Enhancing partnerships and increasing fan engagement in the U.S. are high on the agenda.

Vision for Major League Cricket

As the CEO of MLC, Johnny Grave will oversee all aspects of league operations. This includes focusing on league expansion, team development, and forging strategic partnerships. Grave aims to strengthen MLC’s position as the leading professional cricket league in the United States.

Grave expressed his enthusiasm for stepping into this transformative role. "Cricket is loved around the world, and it's exciting to witness its growing fan base here in the United States. I look forward to collaborating with the MLC team to elevate the league, engage with fans, and build a sustainable future for cricket in America," he stated.

Future Prospects and Expansion Plans

Johnny Grave’s appointment comes as MLC prepares for significant changes. The league is entering its third season and actively planning to expand into more U.S. cities in the coming years. Notably, cricket is set to return to the Olympics in 2028, which will reintroduce the sport to American audiences after more than a century.

The start of the MLC's 2025 season is slated for June, with ticket sales expected to begin in May. As anticipation builds, cricket enthusiasts can expect a remarkable season ahead.

About Major League Cricket

Major League Cricket (MLC) stands as the first professional Twenty20 franchise cricket championship in the United States. Exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC showcases superstar players from around the globe, bringing world-class T20 cricket to America. The league comprises six teams, including prominent franchises such as the Los Angeles Knight Riders and the Texas Super Kings.

With the sport gaining momentum across the nation, MLC is poised to play a significant role in the future of cricket in the U.S.
